column4: hello, can someone help a novice with finding Windoze shares and mounting them in Ubuntu?  I want to start using Ubuntu instead of Windows for my system, but all the rest of the computers here run windows and have shared drives I need to access
a good start is calling it "windows" not "windoze"
windoze is not an OS, it's called "windows"
in the Server put in the server name - not \\servername
in the share nam, put in the share name, not \sharename
the machine is 192.168.0.8 (aka zaphod) and the shared folder is music
so put the server as 192.168.0.8 and the share as music
I know I am doing something worng
think I figured it out... there is no network ;-)
I am using xubuntu.  The network browser must not be installed (xubuntu is the one configured for older hardware, they must have left that one out)
that makes more sense, I don't know about the xfce layout off the top of my head, but people in #xubuntu will
